meanings.definition: The quality or condition of being interactive.
meanings.sent1: The interactivity of the game allowed players to control the characters.
meanings.sent2: The website's interactivity made it easy for users to navigate and explore.
meanings.sent3: The interactivity of the robot vacuum cleaner amused the cat, who tried to chase it around.
meanings.sent4: The interactivity between the audience and the magician created a magical atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The interactivity of the museum exhibit made learning fun and engaging.

meanings.definition: The ability to interact with a computer or other electronic device.
meanings.sent1: Children enjoy the interactivity of educational apps on tablets.
meanings.sent2: The interactivity of the touchscreen allows users to easily select options.
meanings.sent3: The interactivity of the smartwatch entertained the user with its various features.
meanings.sent4: The interactivity of the virtual reality game transported players to a different world.
meanings.sent5: The interactivity of the digital whiteboard revolutionized classroom engagement.
